text: The women's 200 metres at the 2010 European Athletics Championships was held at the Estadi Olímpic Lluís Companys on July 30 and July 31. ==Medalists== {| class="wikitable" style=" text-align:center; " width="35%" |- |bgcolor="gold"|Gold|| Myriam Soumaré France (FRA) |- |bgcolor="silver"|Silver|| Yelizaveta Bryzhina Ukraine (UKR) |- |bgcolor="CC9966"|Bronze|| Aleksandra Fedoriva Russia (RUS) |} ==Records== {| class="wikitable" width=75% |- !colspan="5"|Standing records prior to the 2010 European Athletics Championships |- |World record | |21.34 |Seoul, South Korea |29 September 1988 |- |rowspan=4|European record |rowspan=2| |rowspan=4|21.71 |Karl-Marx-Stadt, East Germany |10 June 1979 |- |Potsdam, East Germany |21 July 1984 |- |rowspan=2| |Jena, East Germany |29 June 1986 |- |Stuttgart, West Germany |29 August 1986 |- |Championship record | |21.71 |Stuttgart, West Germany |29 August 1986 |- |World Leading | |21.98 |New York City, United States |12 June 2010 |- |European Leading | |22.41 |Saransk, Russia |15 July 2010 |- !colspan="5"|Broken records during the 2010 European Athletics Championships |- |European Leading | |22.32 |Barcelona, Spain |31 July 2010 |} ==Schedule== {| class="wikitable" !
